div.p: THE Chriſtian Doctrine: OR, A Short CATECHISM.
BRIEFLY Shewing how to become a Chriſtian: How to continue a Chriſtian.
Divided into ten Heads, for the eaſe of Memory.
Approved by ſundry Elders of the Baptized Churches.

q.p: Be ready always to give an anſwer to every man that asketh you a reaſon of the hope that is in you, with meekneſs and fear.

div.p: LONDON, Printed for Francis Smith, at the Elephant and Caſtle in Cornhil, near the Royal-Exchange, 1678.

div.head: To thoſe that deſire Inſtruction.
div.p: Out of pity to Mankind, conſidering how many die in their Youth, and without Knowledge, I have with much brevity gathered this ſmall Work, for the Inſtruction of Youth, that they might learn to remember their Creator. Mind it: If thou get Knowledge, praiſe God, and pray to him that I may always obey him.

closer.signed: Thine in the Lord, J. S.

div.head: What the ten Heads treat of.

list.item: 3. Of the Principles of the Chriſtian Doctrine.
10. Of the general Love of God to Mankind.

div.head: THE Chriſtian Doctrine.

p.label: Queſt.
p.hi: WHat art thou by Religion?

div.p: Anſw. A Chriſtian, Act. 11.26.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What is a Chriſtian?

div.p: A. One that truly believes in the Lord Jeſus Chriſt, and Joh. 8.31. continues ſtedfaſtly in his Doctrine,

p.label: Q.
p.hi: How cameſt thou to be a Chriſtian?

div.p: A. I did repent me of my ſins paſt, Act. 2.38. believe in the Lord Jeſus Chriſt, and was baptized with Water,

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What didſt thou become thereby?

div.p: A. A Member of Chriſt and his Church,1 Cor. 11.27. a Child of God, Gal. 3.26, 27, 28. and an Heir of the Kingdom of Heaven,

div.head: Of Man's ſtate by Nature.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: In what ſtate are all unconverted Men?

div.p:
A. Strangers to God, without Chriſt, having no Hope, dead Eph. 2.1, 3, 12. in Sins and Treſpaſſes,
by Nature Children of Wrath, Eph. 2.1, 3, 12.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What are the Wages of Sin?

div.p: A. Death, Rom. 6.23.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: How doth God manifeſt his Wrath in this Life?

div.p: A. By ſickneſs in the Lev. 26.16. Body, loſſes in the Amos 4.10. Subſtance, and Lev. 26.16. terror in the Conſcience.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: How in the World to come?

div.p: A. By everlaſting deſtruction1 Theſſ. 1.9. Mat. 8.12. in Hell fire cauſing weeping, walling, and gnaſhing of Teeth,

div.head: Of Man's ſtate by Grace.
div.p: Q. How may Men be delivered from Wrath to come, and obtain Salvation?

A. Only
Act. 4.12. by Jeſus Chriſt,
Q. What hath Chriſt done for Mankind?

A. Died for every Man,
Heb. 2.9.
Q How may one be a Partaker of Chriſt and his Benefits?

A. By a true Faith in him, and Obedience to him,
Joh. 3.16, 17.
Q. How cometh Faith?

A. By hearing
Rom. 10.17. the Word of God,
Q. What Faith moſt avails?

A. That which
Gal. 5.6. works by Love,
Q. How is our Love to God made manifeſt?
A. By keeping his 1 Joh. 5.3. Commandments,

div.head: Of the Principles of the Chriſtian Doctrine.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What are the Foundation-Principles of the Chriſtian Doctrine?

div.p: A. Theſe ſix. 1. Repentance from dead Works. 2. Faith towards God. 3. The Doctrine of Baptiſms. 4. Laying on of Hands. 5. Reſurrection of the Dead. 6. The Eternal Heb. 6.1, 2. Judgment,

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What are dead Works?

div.p: A. Sins and Treſpaſſes.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What is Faith in God the Father?

div.p: A. A ſtedfaſt belief that he is my merciful and Mat. 6.9. loving Father,

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What is Faith in the Son?

div.p: A. A ſure belief that he died for my ſins,1 Cor. 15.4. makes interceſſionRom. 8.34. for me, will ſave me, and his promiſes of Love and Mercy are made to me, if I continue2 Pet. 1.4. Joh. 8.31. in his Word,

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What is Faith in the Holy Ghoſt?

div.p: A. A ſure belief that he will1 Pet. 1.2. Joh. 16.13. ſanctifie me, comfort me, and guide me into all Truth,

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What have they that believe in God rightly?

div.p: A. They are juſtified, Rom. 1.5. and have peace with God,

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What is Juſtification?

div.p: A. A being freed from Rom. 6.7. Rom. 3.22. ſins paſt, and a being accepted as righteous before God,

p.hi: Q. What is Sanctification?

div.p: A. A being Heb. 9.14. Tit. 2.14. purged from the corruption of Nature, and to be indued inwardly with Righteouſneſs,

p.hi: Q. What Graces do uſually appear in a ſanctified Man?

div.p: A. A hatred of Sin, and1 Pet. 1.2. Pſal. 119.10. a willing obedience to God,

p.hi: Q. What Baptiſms are there?

div.p: A. The Baptiſm of Act. 9.38. Mat. 3.11. Water, and the Baptiſm of the Spirit,

p.hi: Q. Who can baptize with the Holy Ghoſt?

div.p: A. Only Mat. 3.11. Jeſus Chriſt,

p.hi: Q. What is Baptiſm with Water?

div.p: A. A being dipt in Water, in the Name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Ghoſt.

p.hi: Q. Why muſt Perſons be ſo born of Water?

div.p: A. That they may enter into the Kingdom Joh 3.5. Act. 2.38. Act. 22.16. of God, and obtain forgiveneſs of ſins,

p.hi: Q. What is laying on of Hands

div.p: A. A laying on of hands Act. 8.15, 16. Act. 19.6. by the Elders of the Church, with Prayer, that they may receive the Holy Ghoſt,

p.hi: Q. What general example is there for the laying on of Hands on every Member?

div.p: A. The example of the Church Act. 8.14 15, 16. in Samaria, and the Brethen at Act. 19.6. Epheſus,

p.hi: Q Who muſt be raiſed again in the Reſurrection?

div.p: A. All that are in the Graves, Joh. 5.28.

p.hi: Q. Who muſt come to the laſt Judgment?

div.p: A. All Mankind, Rev. 20.12, 13. both ſmall and great,

div.head: Of the Eternal Godhead.

p.hi: Q. What is God declared to be?

div.p: A. A Spirit (m) Almighty, and moſt glorious, Joh. 4.24. Gen. 17.1.

p.hi: Q. What are his Attributes?

div.p: A. He is moſt1 Tim. 1.17. Pſal. 139.7. Wiſe, Holy, Eternal, and Incomprehenſible, to the 13th verſe.

p.hi: Q. How is this one God diſtinguiſhed?

div.p: A. Into the Father who begat the Son, into the Son who is begotten, into the Holy Ghoſt who proceedeth1 Joh. 5.7. from the Father and the Son,

p.hi: Q. What is declared of the Father?

div.p: A. That he created Gen. 1.1. Jon. 1.9. the Heaven, the Earth, and the Sea, and all things therein,

p.hi: Q. What is declared of the Son?

div.p: A. That he redeemed us Rev. 5.9. Col. 1.14. by his Blood, makes interceſſion to the Rom. 8.34. Heb. 7.25. Father, ſhall come to2 Tim. 4.1. judge the Quick and Dead,

p.hi: Q. What is declared of the Holy Ghoſt?

div.p: A. That he convinces the Joh. 16.7, 8, 9, 13. ver. 1 Pet. 1.2. World of Sin, comforts and ſanctifies God's People, and leads them into all Truth,

p.hi: Q. What doth the Son declare himſelf to be?

div.p: A. The Light Joh. 8.12. of the World, the Joh. 13 6. Life, and the Joh. 6.35. Bread of Life,

p.hi: Q. What are the Sons eſpecial Offices?

div.p: A. A Mat. 1.21. 2 Pet. 3.18. Saviour, a Act. 3.22. Prophet, a Heb. 3.1. Prieſt, an1 Joh. 2.1. Advocate, a Mat. 25.34. King, and a2 Tim. 4.1. Judge,

div.head: Of every ones Duty.

p.hi: Q. What ought every one to do?

div.p: A. To become Chriſtians?

p.hi: Q. What all our Life after?

div.p: A. To keep God's Commandments, Mat. 19.17. Rev. 22.14.

p.hi: Q. What do the Commandments chiefly contain?

div.p: A. Our Duty to God, and our Duty to our Neighbour, or Men.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What is our duty to God.

div.p: A. To believe Acts 16.31. in him, to fear Luk. 12.5. him, and to love Mat. 22.37. him with all our heart, with all our Soul, Mind and Strength, to Mat. 4.10. worſhip him, to give him thanks, to Joh. 5.23. honour him and truly to Mat. 4. • 0. ſerve him.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What is our duty to Men?

div.p: A. To do Mat. 7.12. to all Men, as we would they ſhould do to us, to love Mat 22.39. our Neighbour as our ſelves, to honour Mat. 19.19. Parents, to honour1 Pet. 2.17. the King and Magiſtrates, and to live juſtly and1 Theſſ. 4.11, 12. honeſtly.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What doth the Grace of God teach us?

div.p: A. To live ſoberly Tit 2.12., righteouſly, and godly.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What are the Duties which abounding make a fruitful Chriſtian?

div.p: A. Theſe eight, (s) Faith, Vertue, Knowledg, Temperance, Patience, Godlineſs, Brotherlykindneſs, Charity,2 Pet. 1.5, 6, 7.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What meanes are to be uſed for the further ſtrengthing our Faith?

div.p: A. Hearing and reading Rom. 10.17. Pſal. 1.2. 1 Theſſ. 5.17. God's Word, Meditation, Prayer, and uſing the1 Cor. 11.2. Ordinances

p.label: Q
p.hi: In whoſe name ought we to pray?

div.p: A. In the name of Joh. 16.23, 24. Jeſus Chriſt.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What form of Prayer hath the Lord left us?

div.p: A. The Lord's Prayer, and after that manner he direct Mat. 6.9. us to pray,

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What may ſometimes be joyned with Prayer?

div.p: A Faſting, Mat. 6.17.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: Whom doth God give Grace unto?

div.p: A. The humble, James 4.6.

div.head: Of the Holy Ordinances.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What holy Ordinances are there more?

div.p: A. The Lord's Supper, anointing with Oil.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: Wherefore was the Lord's Supper ordained?

div.p: A. For the continual remembrance of the Lord's Death, Luk. 22.19. 1 Cor. 11.24, 25. and the benefits we receive thereby.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What are the Creatures to be received in that Supper?

div.p: A. Bread and Wine.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: How do they cauſe us to remember his Death?

div.p: A. Thus, that as the Bread is broken, and the Wine poured out, ſo was the Lord's Body broken for us,1 Cor. 11.24, 25, 26. and his Blood ſhed for our Sins,

p.label: Q.
p.hi: When did the Lord celebrate this Ordinance?

div.p: A. At or after Mat. 26.16. 1 Cor. 11.15. Supper.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What Judgments have befallen unworthy Receivers?

div.p: A. Weakneſs,1 Cor. 11.28, 29, 30. ſickneſs, death, wherefore every Receiver is to examine himſelf.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What did the Lord after that Supper?

div.p: A. Waſh his Joh. 13.5. his Diſciples Feet himſelf.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: Who may be anointed with Oil?

div.p: A. The ſick.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: Who may anoint them?

div.p: A. The Elders Jam. 5.14. of the Church.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: Wherefore?

div.p: A. That the Lord may raiſe Jam. 5.15. them up, and forgive their ſins,

div.head: Of the Chriſtian Warfare.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What enemies do Godly Chriſtians find?

div.p: A. Theſe three, the World, the Fleſh, and the Devil.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What may they find from each of them?

div.p: A. Temptation Mat. 4.3, 4, 5, 6. Jam. 1.14. Joh. 16.33. Rev. 2.10. and Tribulation.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: How doth the Devil appear in his Temptations?

div.p: A. Sometimes with ſubtil wiles, Epheſ. 6.11, 16. and ſometmes with fiery darts,

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What ought a Chriſtian do to withſtand?

div.p: A. Put on the whole Epheſ. 6.11, to verſ. 19. Armour of God.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What if a Chriſtian be in Temptation overcome, and through Weakneſs fall?

div.p:
A. He muſt Repent afreſh Rev. 2.5. Rev. 3.3. 2 Cor. 7.10. with Godly
Sorrow.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What is Godly Sorrow?

div.p: A. A bitter Zech. 10.12. Mat. 26.75. ſorrow that we have offended a loving God.

div.head: Of the Church, and Church-Miniſters.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What are the Perſons that walk according to the Word of God?

div.p: A. The Church.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What doth the Scripture declare the Church to be?

div.p: A. Saints Rom. 1.7. 1 Pet. 2.9., the choſen generation Eph. 2.19., the houſhold of God.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What may the Church do to make known the Goſpel to the World?

div.p: A. Send out faithful Act. 13.3. 2 Cor. 8.23. Men to teach as their Meſſengers.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What Miniſters did the Lord ſet in the Church for taking care of them beſides the Apoſtles?

div.p: A. Elders Act. 20.17, 28. Tit. 1, 5. and Act. 6.2, 3. 1 Tim. 3.8, 12. Deacons.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What is the duty of an Elder or Biſhop?

div.p: A. To watch over the Flock Act. 20.28, 31. 1 Tim 4.1, 2., to Preach, exhort, rebuke with all long-ſuffering and Doctrine.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: How ought he to be qualified?

div.p:
A. He muſt be blameleſs, given to Hoſpitality, apt to teach, Holy, Juſt, Temperate, ruling1 Tim. 3.1, to 8. Tit. 1.7, 8, 9.
his own houſe well, and of good report of them that are without.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What is the Duty of a Deacon?

div.p: A. To ſerve at the Lords Table, Act. 6.1, 2, 3, 4. and adminiſter to the Poor.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: How ought he to be qualified?

div.p: A. He muſt be grave1 Tim. 3.8, 9, 12., holding the myſtery of the Faith in a pure Conſcience, one that rules his own Houſe well.

div.head: Of Church-Power.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What is to be uſed to carnal or careleſs Members?

div.p: A. Warning and1 Theſſ. 5.14. 2 Theſſ. 3.10. Exhortation.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What is to be done to ſuch Members as walk diſorderly, idly, or as buſibodies?

div.p: A. They ought to be withdrawn2 Theſſ. 3.6.14. from.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: How are they to be accounted, the time that they are withdrawn from?

div.p: A. Not as Enemies2 Theſſ. 3.15., but to be admoniſhed as Brethren.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What if they then neglect to hear the Churches admonition to repentance?

div.p: A. They may let them be unto them Mat. 18.17. as Heathen Men and Publicans.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What was done to ſuch as became heinous Sinners, Hereticks ſuch as made ſhipwrack of Faith and a good Conſcience?

div.p: A. They were delivered1 Cor. 5.4, 5. 1 Tim. 1.19, 20. Tit. 3.10. 2 Tim. 2.17, 18. to Satan.

div.head: Of the general love of God to mankind.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: Hath the Lord a deſire that all men ſhould know his Will, that they might be ſaved?

div.p: A. Yes.1 Tim. 2.4.
Q. What Arguments have you out of the Word for this?

A. Theſe: 1. He declared his delight Pro. 8.31. is with the Sons of Men. 2. He ſwares he hath no pleaſure Ezek. 33.11. in the death of Sinners. 3. He made know • his Will both by word and writing Deut. 4.3. Joh. 20.3. to inſtruct them. 4. He ſent his Prophets, and his Son, and his Apoſtles2 Chro. 36.15. 2 Cor. 5.19, 20. to perſwade Men to obey it. 5. He ſo loved them, he gave his Son Joh. 3.16. Heb. 2.9. to die for them. 6. He blames Joh. 5.40. Men for not coming unto him.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: VVhat other Arguments?

div.p: A. He promiſes thoſe that come to him Joh. 6 37. he will not caſt off. 8. He was grieved for Luk. 19.41 42. the deſtruction of Sinners. 9. He declares there is joy in. Luk. 15.7. Heaven at the converſion of Sinners. 10. He waits upon Rom. 2.4. 2 Pet. 3.9. Men with long-ſuffering for their Repentance.
